Comments: Cost: There is a cost overrun of unidentified size. https://la.streetsblog.org/2020/06/09/metro-purple-line-extension-section-1-difficult-tunnelling-resulting-in-cost-overruns/

RR?: It's in the same right-of-way as a commuter line so it can plausibly be 1 and not 0., Stations: Only 6 new stops, but Lechmere is rebuilt, so 7., Cost: Including rolling stock, which is $118 million per https://www.railwaygazette.com/long-reads/boston-building-a-better-t/55983.article, for a total balance of 2,182.
Cost: Many sources say $2.1 billion, which is ex ante, see e.g. mention of the cost overrun at https://observer.com/2013/12/whats-missing-from-the-no-7-line-extension/.
Length: This counts both the short tunnel under the railyard in Queens and the main tunnel in Manhattan.

Cost: This is without rehabilitation of the existing tunnel, $11.3 billion with. The most common cost cited is $11.1 billion without or $13 billion with, e.g. http://hudsontunnelproject.com/faq.html, but there has been an underrun.
Cost: With contingency, without finance charges.
